abstracts.cdata!:
The First Technical Assistance Project
            aims to assist the Government in strengthening the
            macro-economic management capability of key economic
            ministries, strengthening the operational capacity of other
            ministries, and developing a sound institutional framework
            in newly-created ministries and agencies. It will thus
            assist the Government in the formulation and implementation
            of the economic recovery program. Specifically, the project
            will provide for: (a) senior advisors to the Office of the
            President, the Ministry of Economic Coordination, Planning
            and International Cooperation (MEPCI), the Ministry of
            Finance (MF), and the National Bank of Guinea-Bissau (BNG).
            These are the prinicipal authorities responsible for
            economic policy and management. The project will,
            furthermore, provide; (b) consultants to other Government
            ministries in critical sectors such as commerce, energy and
            industry, fisheries and internal administration. Other
            project components will include; (c) studies to assist in
            the definition and implementation of economic adjustment and
            financial stabilization measures; (d) training of
            counterpart staff, including fellowships for training
            locally and abroad; and, finally (e) equipment, materials,
            vehicles and housing for use by project advisors and consultants.
